definition: To leave something or someone behind, often suddenly or permanently.
example: The sailors had to abandon the ship during the storm.

definition: Existing or available in large quantities; plentiful.
example: The garden is abundant with fresh vegetables in summer.

definition: To change something to suit different conditions or uses.
example: She had to adapt quickly to the new work environment.

definition: Having a strong desire to succeed or achieve something.
example: He is an ambitious student who dreams of becoming a doctor.

definition: Genuine and true, not fake or copied.
example: This restaurant serves authentic Italian cuisine.

definition: Producing good or helpful results or effects.
example: Regular exercise is beneficial to your health.

definition: Very bright or intelligent; impressive or clever.
example: She gave a brilliant performance at the concert.

definition: Quick and energetic in movement or activity.
example: They went for a brisk walk in the morning.

definition: Very strange or unusual.
example: He wore a bizarre outfit to the party.

definition: A fence or obstacle that prevents movement or access.
example: The fallen tree created a barrier on the road.

definition: To make something clear or easier to understand.
example: The teacher clarified the instructions for the exam.

definition: Careful to avoid danger or mistakes.
example: She was cautious when crossing the icy road.

definition: A feeling of sympathy and concern for othersâ€™ suffering.
example: He showed great compassion to the homeless.

definition: To give or help to achieve something together with others.
example: Everyone contributed ideas to the group project.

definition: Extremely important or necessary.
example: Getting enough sleep is crucial for good health.

definition: Truthful and straightforward; frank.
example: She gave a candid response during the interview.

definition: To honor or mark an occasion with joy or festivity.
example: They celebrated her graduation with a big party.

definition: To bring two or more things together.
example: We combined our ideas to create one final plan.

definition: Having the ability, fitness, or quality necessary to do something.
example: She is capable of leading the entire team.

definition: To fall down or give way suddenly.
example: The building collapsed after the earthquake.
